The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.
A privately held company located in Birmingham AL

Your attorney&#8217;s concentration will not be divided among multiple types of legal matters. Our law firm provides this representation through continuing training, research, dedication and experience in this field. The firm handles all types of Alabama divorce issues, including contested and uncontested divorce, child custody, visitation, child support, alimony, and property division. Our law firm can advise you about prenuptial and post-nuptial agreements, common law marriages, and legal separations. The Burleson Firm also handles other Alabama family law issues including, but not limited to, paternity, dependency and adoption.&#10;From a central location in Birmingham, Alabama, Ms. Burleson has helped families in Alabama with divorce and family law issues for over 20 years. Our founder understands that facing a family law issue can be a frightening and emotional time. Divorce and child custody issues can be even more stressful because the outcome is often one of the most pivotal events in your life. Ms. Burleson has had personal experience with the Alabama family law system. She, herself, is the divorced parent of two small children. She has faced many common family law issues and understands their importance to you and your family. Ms. Burleson appreciates what you are going through and seeks to relieve as much of your emotional burden as possible. She shows her clients understanding and compassion. However, she also provides strong, aggressive representation against their opponents. She has triumphed over divorce in Alabama and you can too. She believes that it is an honor to receive your trust. Ms. Burleson knows that your family law case is not just another legal case. It is YOUR family's future. About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

Mr. Beard brings a multitude of diverse experiences to the field of law. Mr. Beard’s experiences range from a Chief Helicopter Pilot/Deputy for the Walton County Sherriff’s Office, IT Systems Administrator, to a successful entrepreneur. Mr. Beard has real world experience in most aspects of the law.  Law Enforcement Experience:  As a law enforcement officer, Mr. Beard learned first-hand how to properly handle arrests, investigations, witnesses, evidence, and case preparation.  These prior experiences aid Mr. Beard’s ability to adequately defend his clients when faced with criminal charges.  Information Technology:  Mr. Beard has spent years in the IT field and understands the interworking of service providers, websites, DNS routing, and data recovery.  Mr. Beard is able to use this experience to manage, maintain, and restore data pertinent to client’s cases as well as defend clients when faced with litigious issues surrounding personal/corporate internet and software usage.  Business Experience:  Mr. Beard has started several independent entities that remain successful to this day.  Dealing with issues that have surrounded his own companies, Mr. Beard has gained real world experience in Contracts, Construction Litigation, Usurpation of Corporate Ideas or Assets, General Corporate/Business Formation, Corporate/Business Maintenance, Trademarks, Tax & Employer Liability, Workers Compensation, Commercial Leases, and Complex Partnerships.  Protecting assets and limiting liability within the allowable set of parameters is the main goal Mr. Beard strives to fulfill when consulting with his clients.   Mr. Beard acquired his undergraduate degree from the University of West Florida and received his Juris Doctorate from the Birmingham Law School.  Mr. Beard has created his practice around integrity, a servant’s heart, and an open mind.  If for some reason Mr. Beard feels it is in your best interest to allow another attorney handle your case, Mr. Beard will promptly refer your case to an attorney specific to your issue.  Call or contact us today for your consultation.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.
A privately held company located in Birmingham AL

Business Information: The Burleson Firm is proud to serve the citizens of the entire state of Alabama in all areas of family law from its central location in the Birmingham metropolitan area. In our complex society, it is difficult and impractical for any Alabama attorney to remain current on every legal topic. The Burleson Firm strives to provide the highest level of skill and the latest available legal information. The Burleson law firm narrows its primary focus to the area of Alabama family law. Your attorney&#8217;s concentration will not be divided among multiple types of legal matters. In all but the most unusual cases, your attorney will be dealing with familiar issues that are addressed routinely every day. The primary goal of The Burleson Firm is to provide clients with the best possible representation in the field of Alabama family law. Our law firm provides this representation through continuing training, research, dedication and experience in this field. The firm handles all types of Alabama divorce issues, including contested and uncontested divorce, child custody, visitation, child support, alimony, and property division. We regularly represent clients concerning post-divorce issues such as modification and contempt. Our law firm can advise you about prenuptial and post-nuptial agreements, common law marriages, and legal separations. The Burleson Firm also handles other Alabama family law issues including, but not limited to, paternity, dependency and adoption.&#10;From a central location in Birmingham, Alabama, Ms. Burleson has helped families in Alabama with divorce and family law issues for over 20 years. She has successfully helped clients to achieve their goals, not only in Birmingham, but also in numerous counties throughout the state of Alabama. Our founder understands that facing a family law issue can be a frightening and emotional time. Divorce and child custody issues can be even more stressful because the outcome is often one of the most pivotal events in your life. Ms. Burleson has had personal experience with the Alabama family law system. She, herself, is the divorced parent of two small children. She has faced many common family law issues and understands their importance to you and your family. Ms. Burleson appreciates what you are going through and seeks to relieve as much of your emotional burden as possible. She shows her clients understanding and compassion. However, she also provides strong, aggressive representation against their opponents. She has triumphed over divorce in Alabama and you can too. She believes that it is an honor to receive your trust. Ms. Burleson knows that your family law case is not just another legal case. It is YOUR family's future. The firm’s founder was admitted to the Alabama State Bar in 1990 after graduating from Cumberland School of Law at Samford University in Birmingham, Alabama. Ms. Burleson’s background is evidence of the uncommon level of intelligence that she brings to the practice of law. Not only did Ms. Burleson graduate from high school in 1984 as valedictorian of her class, but she did so at the unusually young age of 15. She then attained a Bachelor of Science degree from top-ranked Birmingham-Southern College. Ms. Burleson’s had a double major in accounting and mathematics. In 1987, at the age of 19, Ms. Burleson graduated summa cum laude from BSC and was honored to be chosen for membership in Phi Beta Kappa. In May 1990, she then earned her Juris Doctor degree from Cumberland School of Law where she was a member of the American Journal of Trial Advocacy. Cumberland’s motto is “Seek wisdom to temper justice with compassion.” Ms. Burleson was then admitted to the Alabama State Bar in October of 1990 at the age of 22. She is a member of the Family Law Section of the Alabama State Bar and the Litigation Section of the Alabama State Bar. Ms. Burleson is also admitted to the United States District Court, Northern District of Alabama and the United States Supreme Court. She has received negotiation training from the Latz Negotiation Institute and is a skilled and experienced negotiator. She has also attended arbitration training at the Alabama State Bar headquarters in Montgomery, Alabama.
